title: How to Make Chicken and Dumplings

steps.headline: Start with an already roasted chicken from your local market.
steps.description: The heavier the seasoning the better. De-bone and separate the chicken. Meat into one bowl, skin into another bowl and discard the bones.

steps.headline: Go through the chicken meat to make sure there is no cartilage, bones or excess fat.
Go through the chicken skin and discard the fattier pieces and keeping the heaviest of the seasoned pieces.
Wash thoroughly the carrots, celery and potato.
steps.description: Dice the carrots, celery and onion. Cube the potato into small pieces. Mince the garlic.

steps.headline: In a bowl, mix Bisquick and powdered rosemary & dried parsley.
steps.description: Add milk and stir until loosely mixed.

steps.headline: Heat up a large pot on high.
Add chicken skin, carrots, celery & onions to the pot.
Cook, stirring to avoid burning, for about 5 minutes.
Toss in the garlic and stir for a few seconds.
steps.description: Be careful not to let the ingredients burn.

steps.headline: De-glaze the bottom with the Chicken stock and then add potatoes.
Bring to just under a boil than turn to medium heat and add thyme and sage.
Add Chicken to the pot and simmer for about 30 minutes so that all the flavors can combine.
Once the soup is flavored to taste drop spoon fulls of dumpling dough into the pot.
steps.description: Yes that's right. Spoon fulls of raw dough go into the hot soup. Trust me. Now let this simmer at medium for 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Turn the heat down to low, cover and simmer for another 10 minutes to cook the top side of the dumplings.
Ladle into large bowls and serve with fresh ground pepper.

text: Start with an already roasted chicken from your local market. The heavier the seasoning the better. De-bone and separate the chicken. Meat into one bowl, skin into another bowl and discard the bones. Go through the chicken meat to make sure there is no cartilage, bones or excess fat. Tear the pieces into chunks. Go through the chicken skin and discard the fattier pieces and keeping the heaviest of the seasoned pieces. Finally chop the saved skin. Wash thoroughly the carrots, celery and potato. Dice the carrots, celery and onion. Cube the potato into small pieces. Mince the garlic. In a bowl, mix Bisquick and powdered rosemary & dried parsley. Add milk and stir until loosely mixed. Heat up a large pot on high.  Add chicken skin, carrots, celery & onions to the pot.  Cook, stirring to avoid burning, for about 5 minutes.  Toss in the garlic and stir for a few seconds. Be careful not to let the ingredients burn. De-glaze the bottom with the Chicken stock and then add potatoes.  Bring to just under a boil than turn to medium heat and add thyme and sage.  Add Chicken to the pot and simmer for about 30 minutes so that all the flavors can combine.  Taste and salt as needed.  Once the soup is flavored to taste drop spoon fulls of dumpling dough into the pot. Yes that's right. Spoon fulls of raw dough go into the hot soup. Trust me. Now let this simmer at medium for 10 minutes. Turn the heat down to low, cover and simmer for another 10 minutes to cook the top side of the dumplings.  Ladle into large bowls and serve with fresh ground pepper.  Finished.
